biography.known_for: One of the most influential skateboarders of all time; popularizing vert skateboarding; landing the first documented 900 in competition (1999); and the Tony Hawk's Pro Skater video game franchise.
biography.early_life: Tony Hawk was born in San Diego, California, and raised in the area. He began skateboarding as a child and quickly showed exceptional aptitude, progressing rapidly in vert skating. As a teenager he turned professional and became a dominant competitor, developing a reputation for technical innovation and consistency. His early success was supported by a growing skate industry in Southern California and by sponsorships that helped him compete nationally and internationally.
biography.career_summary: Hawk turned pro in the early 1980s and became a leading figure in vert skateboarding, winning numerous major contests and helping define modern aerial trick progression. He is widely credited with landing the first documented 900 (two-and-a-half rotations) during the 1999 X Games, a landmark moment in action-sports history. Beyond competition, he helped build skateboarding’s mainstream visibility through media, endorsements, and especially the Tony Hawk's Pro Skater video game series (launched in 1999), which became one of the most successful skateboarding game franchises. He also founded and led skateboarding-related businesses, including a long-running skateboard company and later ventures focused on skatepark development and youth access to skating.
biography.personal_life: Tony Hawk has been married multiple times and has four children. His son Riley Hawk is also a professional skateboarder. Hawk has spoken publicly about balancing family life with extensive travel and business responsibilities, and he is known for maintaining close ties to the skateboarding community while supporting charitable efforts related to youth recreation and skatepark access.
biography.net_worth: Estimated at approximately USD $140 million (varies by source and year).
biography.current_status: Hawk remains active in skateboarding through occasional skating, media appearances, brand partnerships, and business projects. He continues philanthropic work supporting public skateparks and youth access to action sports, and he remains closely associated with the Tony Hawk's Pro Skater franchise and skateboarding culture.
fun_facts: He landed the first widely documented 900 in competition at the 1999 X Games.
The Tony Hawk's Pro Skater franchise (first released in 1999) helped introduce skateboarding to a global mainstream audience.
His son Riley Hawk followed him into professional skateboarding.
He is widely recognized for supporting skatepark development and youth access to skating through philanthropic initiatives.

timeline.title: Born in San Diego, California
timeline.description: Anthony Frank Hawk was born in San Diego, California, USA.

timeline.title: Begins skateboarding
timeline.description: Hawk began skateboarding at age nine, quickly showing exceptional talent.

timeline.title: Turns professional
timeline.description: Hawk turned professional as a young teenager, entering the pro contest circuit.

timeline.title: Joins the Powell Peralta team
timeline.description: Hawk became a member of the influential Powell Peralta skate team, associated with the Bones Brigade era.

timeline.title: Launches Birdhouse (early company formation)
timeline.description: Hawk began building his business presence in skateboarding, leading to the later formation of Birdhouse Skateboards as a major brand.

timeline.title: Becomes dominant vert competitor
timeline.description: By the mid-1980s, Hawk was widely recognized as one of the top vert skateboarders, winning major contests and pushing technical progression.

timeline.title: Graduates high school and continues pro career
timeline.description: Hawk balanced school with competition and continued full-time professional skateboarding after graduation.

timeline.title: Birdhouse Skateboards founded (with Per Welinder)
timeline.description: Hawk co-founded Birdhouse Skateboards, which became one of the best-known skateboard deck brands.

timeline.title: Skateboarding industry downturn and financial pressure
timeline.description: As skateboarding’s popularity dipped in the early 1990s, Hawk faced reduced income and uncertainty despite his competitive success.

timeline.title: Marries Cindy Dunbar
timeline.description: Hawk married Cindy Dunbar; the couple later had two children.

timeline.title: Birth of son Riley Hawk
timeline.description: Hawk’s first child, Riley Hawk, was born; Riley later became a professional skateboarder.

timeline.title: X Games debut and renewed mainstream attention
timeline.description: The launch of ESPN’s X Games helped bring skateboarding back into the mainstream; Hawk became one of its defining stars.

timeline.title: Birth of son Spencer Hawk
timeline.description: Hawk’s second child, Spencer Hawk, was born.

timeline.title: Divorces Cindy Dunbar
timeline.description: Hawk and Cindy Dunbar divorced.

timeline.title: Lands the first documented 900 in competition
timeline.description: At the X Games, Hawk landed the first widely recognized 900 (two-and-a-half rotations) in a skateboarding competition, a defining moment in action sports.

timeline.title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater released
timeline.description: The first Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater video game launched, becoming a major hit and expanding skateboarding’s cultural reach.

timeline.title: Marries Erin Lee
timeline.description: Hawk married Erin Lee; they later had two children.

timeline.title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 2 becomes a defining sequel
timeline.description: Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 2 further cemented the franchise’s popularity and influence on sports gaming and skate culture.

timeline.title: Birth of son Keegan Hawk
timeline.description: Hawk’s third child, Keegan Hawk, was born.

timeline.title: Launches the Tony Hawk Foundation
timeline.description: Hawk founded the Tony Hawk Foundation to help fund public skateparks in underserved communities (later renamed The Skatepark Project).

timeline.title: Birth of daughter Kadence Hawk
timeline.description: Hawk’s fourth child, Kadence Hawk, was born.

timeline.title: Retires from full-time professional competition
timeline.description: Hawk stepped back from full-time competition while continuing to skate, tour, and pursue business and media projects.

timeline.title: Divorces Erin Lee
timeline.description: Hawk and Erin Lee divorced.

timeline.title: Marries Lhotse Merriam
timeline.description: Hawk married Lhotse Merriam.

timeline.title: Divorces Lhotse Merriam
timeline.description: Hawk and Lhotse Merriam divorced.

timeline.title: Tony Hawk Foundation renamed The Skatepark Project (later branding evolution)
timeline.description: The foundation’s identity evolved over time; it became widely known as The Skatepark Project, continuing to fund public skatepark development.

timeline.title: Marries Catherine Goodman
timeline.description: Hawk married Catherine Goodman.

timeline.title: Skateboarding confirmed for the Olympic Games (Tokyo 2020)
timeline.description: Skateboarding was added to the Olympic program, a milestone for the sport that Hawk helped popularize globally.

timeline.title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 released
timeline.description: A modern remaster of the first two games launched to strong critical and commercial reception, introducing the franchise to a new generation.

timeline.title: Skateboarding debuts at the Olympics (Tokyo 2020 held in 2021)
timeline.description: Skateboarding made its Olympic debut, reflecting decades of growth in which Hawk played a central ambassadorial role.

timeline.title: The Skatepark Project continues nationwide grantmaking impact
timeline.description: By this period, Hawk’s skatepark philanthropy had helped fund hundreds of public skatepark projects, emphasizing access and community development.

timeline.title: Ongoing media appearances and skate advocacy
timeline.description: Hawk remained active in public advocacy for skateboarding, youth recreation, and skatepark development while continuing selective skating and media work.
